sentences.english: The dry river-bed clothes finds no thanks for its past.
sentences.chinese: 枯槁的河床，并不谢谢它的已往。

sentences.english: But God prepared a worm when the morning rose the next day, and it smote the gourd that it withered.
sentences.chinese: 次日黎明，神却安排一条虫子咬这蓖麻，以致枯槁。

sentences.english: The dry river-my bed finds no thanks for its past.
sentences.chinese: 枯槁的河床，实在不感谢它的过往。

sentences.english: He was thin and haggard and he looked miserable.
sentences.chinese: 他肥强枯槁，望下去一正不幸相。

sentences.english: Capello needs to refresh a dynamism that has waned.
sentences.chinese: 卡佩罗需要激发球队业已枯槁的活力。

sentences.english: But it was not enough to damp the parched ground.
sentences.chinese: 但是这一阵雨是灌溉不了枯槁的土地的。

sentences.english: Plants are also tender and supple when alive, only to become dry and brittle when they die.
sentences.chinese: 草木之生也柔弱，其死也枯槁。

sentences.english: And, behold, seven ears, withered, thin, and blasted with the east wind, sprung up after them
sentences.chinese: 随后又长了七个穗子，枯槁细弱，被东风吹焦了。

sentences.english: After them, seven other heads sprouted-withered and thin and scorched by the east wind.
sentences.chinese: 随后又长了七个穗子，枯槁细弱，被东风吹焦了。
